item.title: Programming game with Swift and SpriteKit
item.description:
DAY 1 : From almost nowhere

I got a 1-year intense experience in Objective-C and iOS app programming. Now I want to catch up programers who code in Swift. Moreover, as I have never coded a game, it would be cool if I can do both : learn Swift and Game programming.

I found this page which seems very interesting : http://kgoddard.net/tutorial/swift/xcode/spritekit/ios/2015/03/21/spritekit-swift-part-1-creating-game-scene.html

I spent one hour on this, and my impression was good : do it ! You will learn how to create a class, create constants, methods, and most of all, begin to understand SpriteKit. Nice tuto.

item.title: It's said "Welcome to Jekyll!"
item.description:
Jekyll is a blog engine I’ve never heard before I started to learn game programming, and furthermore, with Swift. I’ll do this like the other stars I’d like to join. With Git, Github and Github Pages.

Day 0 : Install Jekyll on my machine. No. Install the prerequisites first. Check. Install Jekyll on my machine. Check. First post. So easy. Check. First github pages…. First github pages…prerequisites. First github pages… Well, not check. So I’m the only privileged user to read my post. Me, myself, and I. Better than Facebook huh ?
